document.docAuthor: Webb, Donald W. & Metz, Mark A.
document.masterDocTitle: A Revision of the New World Genera Brachylinga Irwin and Lyneborg and Lysilinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the Description of a New Genus, Elcaribe Webb

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Revision of the New World Genera Brachylinga Irwin and Lyneborg and Lysilinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the Description of a New Genus, Elcaribe Webb

subSubSection.paragraph: Laculatus (Latin) = four­cornered. This name is used as an adjective and refers to quadrate shape of the gonocoxite in lateral view ( Fig. 83 ).

Brachylinga laculata
is taxonomically associated with
B. ornatifrons
in possessing setae on the katepisternum; in having the halter knob dark reddish brown; and in having the foretibia dark yellow, apex dark reddish brown.
Brachylinga laculata
differs from
B. ornatifrons
in having the wing cell m 3 open widely; tergite 8 ( Fig. 14 ) thick medially; the gonocoxite ( Fig. 37 ) with a large gonocoxal bridge; and the distiphallus in dorsal view ( Fig. 129 ) tapered apically with a narrow dorsal carina.

Head. Length 0.64 mm . Ommatidia smaller ventrally and laterally. Frons pruinescence silver, black dorsally with small black circle dorsolateral to antennal base; setae black. Antenna/head length 0.67; black, pruinescence gray on scape; scape length 0.20 mm , width 0.14 mm , length/width 1.7, scape/pedicel length 2.7, scape/flagellum width 0.93, setae black, elongate, grading into macrosetae; pedicel length 0.07 mm , length/width 0.5; flagellum length 0.29 mm , width 0.15 mm , length/width 1.9, flagellum/ scape length 1.2. Parafacial pruinescence gray. Maxillary palpus dark brown, pruinescence gray, length 0.32 mm , length/width 5.3; setae pale brownish yellow. Genal setae white. Occipital setae white becoming pale brownish yellow dorsally. Postocular macrosetae dark reddish brown.

Thorax. Macrosetae dark reddish brown, 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 1 dc, 2 sc. Mesonotum dark brown, pruinescence brownish gray; setae black, elongate intermixed with white setae laterally and across anterior margin. Pleuron and scutellum black, pruinescence gray; setae white on propleuron, anepisternum, katepisternum, laterotergite, metanepisternum, and scutellum. Wing. Membrane hyaline, veins brown; length 5.0 mm, length/width 2.8; pterostigma dark brown; cell m 3 open widely. Halter dark brown. Legs. Coxa setae white intermixed with dark brown setae, present on posterior surface of midcoxa; macrosetae dark reddish brown. Femora dark brown, pruinescence gray; ventral setae white intermixed with brown setae; av 0:0:5, pv 0:0:4. Tibiae dark yellow, apex reddish brown. Tarsomeres 1–2 dark yellow, apex reddish brown; 3–5 dark reddish brown.
Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 1 dc, 2 sc. Legs. Anteroventral macrosetae 0–1:0:2–4, pv 0:0:1–4.
Similar to male except for following.
Head. Frons dark brown, pruinescence gray, whitish gray ventrally with small brown circle dorsolaterally; setae black, elongate. Antenna with setae on scape pale yellow intermixed with black setae.
Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 1 dc, 2 sc. Legs. Anteroventral macrosetae 0–1:0:3–4, pv 0:0:2–4.

Abdomen. Dark reddish brown, tergite 4 glossy, pruinescence gray on tergites 1 and 5 and posterolaterally on tergites 2–3; dorsal setae dark reddish brown and white, elongate, erect on tergite 1 and pruinescent areas of tergites 2–3.
Terminalia
(MEI 076179) dark reddish brown. Furca ( Fig. 195 ) rectangular, posterior margin rounded, sides parallel, anterior margin truncate; length 0.42 mm , width 0.26 mm ; anterolateral projections absent. Common duct ( Fig. 195 ) shorter than furca. Spermathecal duct ( Fig. 195 ) diverging anteriorly.
Immature Stages. One female (MEI 040886) has been reared from a larva collected 30 km E La Ribera, Rancho Las Barracas from a sand habitat.

Distribution Brachylinga laculata
is known from Mexico , Baja California Sur ( Fig. 215 ).

Brachylinga laculata
has been collected in pan traps with a few specimens collected in Malaise traps or handnetted on
Prosopis juliflora (Sw.) DC.
Adults have been collected from February to May and October and November.
